head.title: Writing away for tickets, or trying to get on camera

hedline.hl1: Writing away for tickets, or trying to get on camera

block.p: Where and When

''The Daily Show With Jon Stewart'' on Comedy Central tapes Monday through Thursday at 513 West 54th Street. Doors open at 5:45 p.m. Advance tickets: (212) 586-2477. Any extra seats are given out at that number on Fridays from 11:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. for the next week.

''Late Night With Conan O'Brien'' tapes from 5:30 to 6:30 p.m. Tuesday through Friday, at NBC Studios, 30 Rockefeller Plaza. For advance tickets, write with the address and telephone number to NBC Tickets, 30 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, N.Y. 10112; (212) 664-3056 or 664-3057. Lottery numbers for standby tickets are handed out on the day of the show at 9 a.m. at the 49th Street entrance.
Where and When

''The Daily Show With Jon Stewart'' on Comedy Central tapes Monday through Thursday at 513 West 54th Street. Doors open at 5:45 p.m. Advance tickets: (212) 586-2477. Any extra seats are given out at that number on Fridays from 11:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. for the next week.

''Late Night With Conan O'Brien'' tapes from 5:30 to 6:30 p.m. Tuesday through Friday, at NBC Studios, 30 Rockefeller Plaza. For advance tickets, write with the address and telephone number to NBC Tickets, 30 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, N.Y. 10112; (212) 664-3056 or 664-3057. Lottery numbers for standby tickets are handed out on the day of the show at 9 a.m. at the 49th Street entrance.

''Maury,'' the syndicated talk show hosted by Maury Povich, is taped, usually on Tuesdays through Thursdays, at Studios USA in the Hotel Pennsylvania on West 33rd Street between Avenue of the Americas and Seventh Avenue. Audience members generally arrive at 8:30 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. for tapings at 10 and 12:30. For advance tickets, write ''Maury'' Tickets, Studios USA, Hotel Pennsylvania, 15 Penn Plaza, Grand Ballroom, New York, N.Y. 10001; (212) 244-7545. Include name, address, phone number, dates and number of tickets; must be 18 or older unless accompanied by an adult.
''Montel Williams'' tapes Wednesdays and Thursdays at 10:30 a.m., 1:30 and 3:30 p.m. at 433 West 53rd Street; ages 18 and older; (212) 989-8101.

''The Rosie O'Donnell Show'' tapes at 10 a.m. Monday through Thursday and at 2 p.m. on Thursday (for Friday shows) at NBC Studios, 30 Rockefeller Plaza. Standbys line up at 7:30 a.m. on the 49th Street side of 30 Rockefeller Plaza. Advance tickets are issued through a lottery; none are available through June. Send a postcard to: The Rosie O'Donnell Show, Tickets, 30 Rockefeller Plaza, Suite 800E, New York, N.Y. 10112; one postcard, two tickets per household.

''Total Request Live'' on MTV broadcasts Monday through Friday from 1515 Broadway in Times Square. Ticket requests: (212) 398-8549. The guest list can be seen at www.mtv.com. The audience lines up at Broadway and West 44th Street at 2:30 p.m.; any standby tickets available are distributed there.

''Who Wants to Be a Millionaire'' tapes at the ABC Studios, 30 West 67th Street, on weekdays at varying times. Send a postcard to Who Wants to Be a Millionaire Tickets, Columbia University Station, Box 250225, New York, N.Y. 10025. Information: (212) 735-5369 or www.abc.go.com. Audience members must be over 18. There is no formal system for standby tickets.
More New York Shows
Following is a selection of the shows broadcast from New York.
''The Early Show'' on CBS is seen from 7 to 9 a.m. Monday to Friday. To try to be seen on camera: Stand at Trump International Plaza, Fifth Avenue and 59th Street.
''Emeril Live,'' on the Food Network, tapes three shows a day for a week every two months or so. Tickets are awarded by lottery through its Web site: www.foodtv.com.

''Good Morning America'' is televised on ABC from 7 to 9 a.m. Monday through Friday. To try to be seen on camera: Stand outside at West 44th Street and Broadway starting at 6:30. Some audience members are admitted into the studio.

''Late Show With David Letterman'' on CBS tapes Mondays through Thursdays at 5:30 p.m. (and again at 8 p.m. on Thursday for Friday) at 1697 Broadway at West 53rd Street. For advance tickets: Send a postcard to Late Show Tickets, Ed Sullivan Theater, 1697 Broadway, New York, N.Y. 10019. Two tickets per postcard; possible nine-month wait. Standby tickets: call (212) 247-6497 at 11 a.m.; phones are answered until all tickets are gone for the day. Must be 18 or over.

''Live With Regis and Kathie Lee'' is on Monday through Friday on ABC from 9 to 10 a.m. Advance tickets: send a self-addressed, stamped envelope to Live Tickets, Box 230777, Ansonia Station, New York, N.Y. 10023. Up to four tickets allowed. Standbys can get a number from 6:50 to 7 a.m. at the studios at 7 Lincoln Square (West 67th Street and Columbus Avenue), returning by 8:30 to find out if they have a seat; audience members must be age 10 or older.

''Saturday Night Live'' is on NBC. For advance tickets, write: Saturday Night Live, NBC Tickets, 30 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, N.Y. 10012. Ticket requests are accepted only in August and are awarded by lottery several weeks before each show. A small number of standby tickets are distributed at 9:15 a.m. Saturdays outside the 49th Street entrance of 30 Rockefeller Plaza. Two performances: dress rehearsal and live show. Audience members should arrive by 7 p.m. for the dress rehearsal (7:30 p.m. for standby); by 10:15 p.m. for the live show (10:30 p.m. for standby); must be 18 or older.
''Today'' is on NBC from 7 to 9 a.m. Monday through Friday. Hopefuls who would like to be seen on camera stand at West 49th Street and Rockefeller Plaza.

''The View'' is on ABC at 11 a.m. Monday through Friday. For advance tickets write to Tickets, The View, 320 West 66th Street, New York, N.Y. 10023. Ticket holders must arrive at the studio by 10 a.m.; arrive earlier to get on the standby-ticket list. Ages 18 or older only.
Other Stops

Museum of Television and Radio, 25 West 52nd Street; (212) 621-6600; www.mtr.org. The museum's library contains more than 100,000 radio and TV programs for listening and viewing in the third floor console room. Open Tuesday through Sunday noon to 6 p.m. and Thursday until 8 p.m. Theaters open until 9 on Friday. Closed Monday. Admission $6.

NBC Studio Tour, 30 Rockefeller Plaza (entrance on West 49th Street), (212) 664-3700. Admission: $17.50 adults; $15 children 6 to 16 and seniors 65 and older, and adults in groups of four or more. No children under 6 are admitted.
RAHADYAN SASTROWARDOYO
